have you created the file as they suggest?
I know nothing about sandvine, but the instructions seem straightforward
did you notice that it says "place the following in a file"?
just copy the red stuff into a gedit window and save the file on your desktop under the name 'iptables-fix'
then open a terminal and run 'sudo $HOME/Desktop/iptables-fix'
then you haven't done what I said, which was to save the file to your Desktop under the name of iptables-fix
once you've done that, it will say 'Permission denied' when you try to run it, so you will have to do a 'chmod +x /home/luke/Desktop/iptables-fix'
that means it has worked. You can 'sudo iptables -L' to get a list of your current rules
do not paste stuff into the channel
now check your speed or whatever you were trying to fix.
